title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4231.13 - Time for making other objections
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4231.13 - Time for making other objections

State Regulations
(a) An objection on (any of the following)
grounds may be received up to 48 hours exclusive of Sunday after the last race
of the last day of the meeting: (1)
of
misstatement, omission or error in the entry under which a horse has run; or
(2)
that the horse which ran was
not the horse nor of the age which he was represented to be at the time of
entry; or
(3)
that he was not
qualified under the conditions of the race or by reason of default; (4)
that he has run in contravention of the
sections relating to partnership or registration. (b) In any other case an objection must be
made within 48 hours of the race being run, exclusive of Sunday, save in the
case of any fraud or willful misstatement, when there shall be no limit to the
time of objection provided the judges are satisfied that there has been no
unnecessary delay on the part of the objector. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4231.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
